title: Cardi B says she was sexually harassed by a photographer during a magazine shoot, and nobody did anything about it
text:

Cardi B has said that she was sexually harassed during a magazine photoshoot, and that the magazine's editor didn't express any sympathy when she told him.

Speaking to radio host Angie Martinez on the interview series "Untold Stories of Hip-Hop," Cardi said that the photographer at the shoot attempted to coerce her into exchanging sex for coverage in the magazine.

"The photographer, he was trying to get close to me like, 'Yeah, you want to get in this magazine?' Then he pulled his d--- out!" Cardi recalled. "I was so f------ mad. I was just like, 'This is crazy.'"

She continued: "I was like, 'You're f------ bugging. You know what? I'm out. But you know what's so crazy? I told the magazine owner and he just looked at me like, 'So? And?'"

Cardi did not name the magazine title, the photographer or the editor in question.

Read more: Tekashi 6ix9ine testified that Cardi B was part of the Nine Trey gang in court, and — as expected — Cardi clowned him for it

Asked about her thoughts on the #MeToo movement, Cardi suggested that for many women living in the Bronx, where she was born and raised, sexual harassment is a regular occurrence.

"There's girls from the hood I know that went through the same type of treatment, like they make you feel like you've got to do a certain type of thing for the most bull---- s---," she said. "It happens, really, every day."

For her, the same treatment wouldn't happen again today, Cardi explained. "Oh hell no, I'd put you on blast on my Instagram," she joked.

The rap star, who recently made her acting debut in the Oscar-tipped Jennifer Lopez stripper drama "Hustlers," last week denied that she was a member of the Nine Trey Gangsta Bloods gang after claims by fellow rapper Tekashi69.

"I have never been 9 Trey or associated with them," Cardi wrote in a tweet.
description: Cardi told radio host Angie Martinez that the photographer at the shoot attempted to coerce her into exchanging sex for coverage in the magazine.
